sections.EXECUTION:
Phase I: Troop Leading Procedures. Begins at receipt of the OPORD and ends with Soldiers ready to SP. Platoon Leader will brief a to standard OPORD then Squad Leader will brief Squad OPORDs
Phase II: Movement. Begins with Soldiers ready to SP and ends with occupation of MFP. Focus on dismounted movement
Phase III: Fire

values: Mortars will move together in a convoy IOT to maximize control on range roads. Vehicles obey posted speed limits, following distances, and general awareness of civilian and other military traffic. Vehicles each have radios and JBCP and conduct commex.

values: Remind soldiers to make sure brakes are set, engine is off, and at least
one wheel is chocked during loading and unloading
Chock blocks and drip pans are required and will be inspected as soon as the MCV sets in position for the gunner. Any additional vehicles must set drip pan and chock block in once arrived on site.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: RSO and OIC will orient soldiers to the range and conduct a safety brief. Soldiers will safety each other and safety will be monitored from Platoon Leader to Soldier and vice versa in order to ensure safe conduct of this STX.
